Investor Wait and See Malah Bikin Pengembang Senang, Kok Bisa?
06 Nov 2019, 10:05 by Vadhia Lidyana


Foto: Fadhly Fauzi Rachman

Jakarta - Di tengah perlambatan ekonomi global membuat para investor wait and see dalam menyuntikkan modalnya. Begitu pula dalam industri properti yang juga ditopang dengan dana investor.Meski begitu, menurut Country Manager Rumah123.com, Maria Herawati Manik sikap investor yang 'puasa' sementara ini justru dapat memberikan angin segar terhadap industri properti. Maria mengatakan, dengan sikap investor tersebut, developer properti bisa memfokuskan diri kepada masyarakat yang belum pernah membeli hunian sebelumnya (first time home buyer). Pasalnya, first time home buyer punya andil yang lebih besar yang dapat mendongkrak pendapatan sang developer ketimbang dana dari investor."Kalau kita lihat secara pie pasti yang paling besar itu bukan investor, tapi opportunities untuk developer yang masih banyak ditangkap itu first time home buyer. Itu adalah pie yang paling besar sebenarnya. Jadi ini sebenarnya opportunity yang bagus untuk orang yang belum punya rumah. Kalau investor menahan, sudah pasti developer harus mencari alternatif dengan menggaet first time home buyer," kata Maria dalam Festival Properti Indonesia di Mal Kota Kasablanka, Jakarta, Rabu (6/11/2019).Bahkan, ia menuturkan jika seorang developer mendapatkan suntikkan dana terlalu banyak dari investor akan berbahaya. Pasalnya, suatu hari sang investor bisa mengatur harga penjualan properti dan itu bisa merugikan pembeli."Investor kalau terus-terusan investasi itu bahaya. Karena pada suatu waktu mereka akan menentukan harga untuk properti. Ini akan bahaya karena ini sudah terjadi di Hong Kong. Yang nge-drive harga itu adalah investor. Dan pada saat mereka mendominasi properti, bagi yang belum punya rumah itu lebih bahaya lagi," terang Maria.Jika investor yang punya kewenangan dalam menetapkan harga, maka akan semakin kecil peluang untuk milenial membeli hunian pertamanya. Sebab, investor yang sudah mengeluarkan dana besar untuk proyek biasanya memang menunggu untuk mendapatkan keuntungan besar."Artinya opportunity untuk mereka beli rumah makin tipis. Karena harganya sudah berlipat-lipat, kan mereka investor. Investor kan dia beli memang untuk menunggu. Pada saat dia sudah berkali-kali lipat dia kan bisa nge-set harga pada saat dia tahu di area A dia lihat, 'wah ini properti-nya optionsnya sudah semakin sedikit.' Akhirnya orang yang mau beli rumah, ah forget it," imbuh dia.Untuk itu, di saat investor wait and see ini menurut Maria waktu yang tepat bagi developer menggaet first time home buyer. Caranya yakni dengan menawarkan sejumlah kemudahan dalam pembelian maupun pembayaran properti."Caranya bisa dengan harga yang ditawarkan. Memang sudah pasti harga properti tidak mungkin turun, tapi banyak kemudahan, banyak program yang ditawarkan, atau tadinya cicilan langsung ke developer bisa ada 60-72 bulan, ya kita nggak tahu mungkin bisa jadi 8-10 tahun," tutupnya.Sebagai informasi, situs properti Rumah123.com menggelar pameran properti di Kota Kasablanka dari 6-10 November. Maria mengungkapkan, tren penjualan properti di Rumah123 meningkat 6% dari tahun 2018. Sedangkan, penjualan properti Rumah123 di kuarta-III 2019 lebih tinggi 33% dari kuartal II-2019.Harapannya, dengan FPI ini maka penjualan properti di Rumah123 bisa meningkat 30% dari penjualan properti di FPI tahun 2018.Simak Video "Wah! Wait and See Investors Even Make Developers Happy, How come?
06 Nov 2019, 10:05 by Vadhia Lidyana


Photo: Fadhly Fauzi Rachman

Jakarta - In the midst of a slowing global economy, investors are waiting and looking to inject capital. Similarly, in the property industry which is also supported by investor funds. Even so, according to Rumah123.com Country Manager, Maria Herawati Manik, investors' attitude of being 'fasting' while this can actually provide fresh air to the property industry. Maria said, with the attitude of these investors, property developers can focus on the people who have never bought a house before (first time home buyer). Because, first time home buyers have a greater share that can boost the income of the developer than funds from investors. "If we look at the pie, the biggest is not the investor, but the opportunities for developers who are still being captured are the first time home buyers. "That is the biggest pie, actually. So this is actually a good opportunity for people who do not have a house yet. If investors hold it, it is certain that developers must find alternatives by attracting first time home buyers," Maria said in the Indonesian Property Festival in Mall Kota Kasablanka, Jakarta, Wednesday (11/06/2019). In fact, he said if a developer gets too much funds from investors it would be dangerous. Because, one day the investor can set the price of the sale of the property and it can harm the buyer. "Investors if the investment continues to be dangerous. Because at some time they will determine the price for the property. This will be dangerous because this has happened in Hong Kong. "The price drive is investors. And when they dominate property, for those who do not have a house, it is even more dangerous," explained Maria. If investors who have the authority to set prices, the less chance for millennials to buy their first home. Because, investors who have spent large funds for projects usually are waiting to get big profits. "This means that the opportunity for them to buy houses is getting thinner. Because the price has multiplied, they are investors. Investors are he buying it to wait. many times he could set prices when he found out in area A he saw, 'wow this is the property of options is getting smaller.' Finally, people who want to buy a house, ah forget it, "he added. For that, when investors wait and see, according to Maria, the right time for developers to hook first time home buyers. The way is by offering a number of facilities in the purchase and payment of property. "The trick can be at the price offered. It is certain that property prices may not go down, but many conveniences, many programs offered, or the direct installments to developers can be 60-72 months "Yes, we do not know maybe it could be 8-10 years," he concluded. For information, the property site Rumah123.com held a property exhibition in the City of Kasablanka from 6-10 November. Maria revealed, the trend of property sales in Rumah123 increased 6% from 2018. Meanwhile, the sale of Rumah123 properties in 2019 third quarter was 33% higher than in the second quarter of 2019. Hopefully, with this FPI, property sales in Rumah123 could increase 30% from sale of property at FPI in 2018. Watch Video "Wow!
